item.title: CERAWEEK 阿美石油公司首席执行官称，猫王演讲比能源转型计划成功的几率更大
item.description: 沙特国家石油巨头沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco 2222.SE）首席执行官周一表示，政策制定者和能源高管需要重新思考能源转型计划，停止加倍执行已经失败的转型内容，并强调需要投资化石燃料以满足全球需求。【原文：Policymakers and energy executives need to rethink energy transition plans and stop doubling down on elements of the transition that have failed, the CEO of state oil giant Saudi Aramco 2222.SE said on Monday, stressing the need for investment in fossil fuels to meet global demand.】

item.title: 纽约州就数据泄露和安全漏洞起诉全州保险公司
item.description: 纽约州周一起诉 Allstate 公司，指控该保险公司的 National General 部门未报告数据泄露事件，暴露了驾驶执照号码，也未制定合理的保障措施来保护投保人的私人信息。【原文：New York state sued Allstate on Monday, accusing the insurer's National General unit of failing to report a data breach that exposed drivers' license numbers, and not developing reasonable safeguards to protect policyholders' private information.】

item.title: CERAWEEK 美国能源部长称全球变暖是现代经济的副作用
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯-赖特（Chris Wright）周一表示，全球变暖是建设现代世界的副作用，并誓言结束前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的气候政策。【原文：US Energy Secretary Energy Secretary Chris Wright said on Monday that global warming is a side effect of building the modern world and vowed to end former President Joe Biden's climate policies.】

item.title: 安赛乐米塔尔暂时停止法国两家主要工厂的生产
item.description: 安赛乐米塔尔公司（ArcelorMittal）周一宣布了一项超过 2.7 亿欧元（2.754 亿美元）的维护计划，其中包括在法国敦刻尔克（Dunkirk）和滨海福斯（Fos-sur-Mer）的工厂停工数月。【原文：ArcelorMittal on Monday announced a more than 270 million euro ($275.4 million) maintenance programme that would include the halt of activities at its plants in Dunkirk and Fos-sur-Mer, France, for several months.】

item.title: CERAWEEK-加拿大总理阿勒塔表示，加拿大可以增加对美国的石油供应，但也需要新的市场
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省省长丹尼尔-史密斯（Danielle Smith）周一表示，该省将继续向美国供应原油，但美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税威胁也凸显了对新市场的需求。【原文：Alberta Premier Danielle Smith said on Monday that the Canadian province would continue to supply crude oil to the United States but that U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff threats also underscored the need for new markets.】

item.title: 欧盟贸易首脑称美国不寻求达成避免关税的协议
item.description: 在美国即将对所有进口钢铁和铝征收关税的前两天，欧盟贸易部长周一表示，特朗普政府似乎没有参与避免与欧盟贸易冲突的谈判。【原文：The Trump administration does not seem to be engaging in talks to avert trade conflict with the European Union, the EU's trade chief said on Monday, two days before the United States is set to impose tariffs on all steel and aluminium imports.】

item.title: 英国 CMA 称大科技监管将关注对英国的影响，并将发布 "路线图 "指南
item.description: 英国反垄断监管机构首席执行官萨拉-卡德尔（Sarah Cardell）周一表示，该机构将重点干预对英国消费者和企业有 "明确而直接 "影响的数字市场，并将为目标大科技公司提供路线图。【原文：Britain's antitrust regulator will focus on interventions in digital markets which have a "clear and direct" impact on UK consumers and businesses, and will give a road map to the Big Tech companies targeted, its CEO Sarah Cardell said on Monday.】

item.title: ServiceNow将以29亿美元收购人工智能公司Moveworks，以开发新客户
item.description: ServiceNow 周一表示，它将以 28.5 亿美元的价格收购人工智能公司 Moveworks，这是这家软件制造商有史以来规模最大的一次收购，因为它希望扩大其产品组合并吸引更多客户。【原文：ServiceNow said on Monday it would buy artificial intelligence company Moveworks for $2.85 billion, marking the software maker's largest-ever acquisition as it looks to expand its product portfolio and attract more customers.】

item.title: ServiceNow将以29亿美元收购人工智能公司Moveworks，以开发新客户
item.description: ServiceNow 周一表示，它将以 28.5 亿美元的价格收购人工智能公司 Moveworks，这是这家软件制造商有史以来规模最大的一次收购，因为它希望扩大其产品组合并吸引更多客户。【原文：ServiceNow said on Monday it would buy artificial intelligence company Moveworks for $2.85 billion, marking the software maker's largest-ever acquisition as it looks to expand its product portfolio and attract more customers.】

item.title: IBM 赢得英国对 LzLabs 指控其窃取大型机技术的诉讼
item.description: IBM 周一在伦敦赢得了对美国科技企业家和慈善家约翰-摩尔斯（John Moores）的公司 LzLabs 的诉讼，这家 IT 巨头指控该公司窃取商业机密。【原文：IBM on Monday won a London lawsuit against U.S. tech entrepreneur and philanthropist John Moores' company LzLabs, which the IT giant accused of stealing trade secrets.】

item.title: 汇丰下调美股评级，转而看好欧洲股市
item.description: 汇丰银行周一以关税的不确定性为由下调了美国股市的评级，但在德国放松财政改革的提振下转而看好欧洲股市。【原文：HSBC on Monday downgraded U.S. equities, citing uncertainty around tariffs, while turned bullish on European stocks following boost from Germany loosening its fiscal reforms.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，新加坡交易所将推出开放式比特币期货上市交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一报道，新加坡交易所计划在2025年下半年上市比特币永续期货，目标客户是机构客户和专业投资者。【原文：The Singapore Exchange plans to list bitcoin perpetual futures in the second half of 2025, targeting institutional clients and professional investors, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.】

item.title: 西班牙时装公司 Mango 2024 年销售额增长 8
item.description: 西班牙时装零售商 Mango 周一公布，2024 年销售额增长 8%，达到 33.3 亿欧元（约合 36.2 亿美元）。【原文：Spanish fashion retailer Mango reported on Monday an 8% increase in sales in 2024 to 3.33 billion euros ($3.62 billion), as it benefitted from an international expansion with a focus on the United States, similar to that pursued by its rival brand Zara.】

item.title: 意大利游艇制造商 Ferretti 计划今年进行收购
item.description: 意大利游艇制造商 Ferretti 首席执行官周一表示，该公司的目标是在今年进行一次收购，但没有具体说明潜在目标是一个品牌、一个船厂还是其他资产。【原文：Italian yacht maker Ferretti aims to make an acquisition this year, its Chief Executive said on Monday, without specifying whether the potential target would be a brand, a yard or another asset.】

item.title: 大众汽车公司的特拉顿认为美国关税不会产生重大影响
item.description: 大众汽车卡车部门在周一的财报后电话会议上表示，Traton 认为美国对从墨西哥进口的汽车征收关税在短期内不会产生重大影响。【原文：Traton does not see a significant impact from U.S. tariffs on imports from Mexico in the short term, Volkswagen's truck unit said during a post-earnings call on Monday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行瘫痪后，欧盟议员对数字欧元表示怀疑
item.description: 欧洲央行现有的支付系统出现故障，导致成千上万的家庭和交易商受到延误，欧洲立法者对欧洲央行的数字欧元项目提出了新的质疑。【原文：European lawmakers are voicing fresh doubt about the European Central Bank’s digital euro project after an outage in the ECB’s existing payment system caused delays for thousands of households and traders.】

item.title: 关税忧虑持续，期货走低；特斯拉下跌
item.description: 美国股指期货周一下跌，原因是市场持续担心特朗普政府的关税政策会影响全球最大的经济体，而电动汽车制造商特斯拉则在券商作出看跌预测后下跌。【原文：U.S. stock index futures fell on Monday as worries persisted that the Trump administration's tariff policies could affect the world's largest economy, while EV maker Tesla declined following a bearish brokerage forecast.】

item.title: 德国支出增长将对全球债券市场产生持久影响
item.description: 德国财政政策的巨变正在迅速改变全球债券市场，因为预计这将增加顶级避险债务的储备，并推动德国进入政府债券收益率结构性上升的新时代。【原文：A sea change in German fiscal policy is rapidly transforming global bond markets as it is expected to increase the pool of top-rated, safe-haven debt and propel Germany into a new era of structurally higher government bond yields.】

item.title: 对冲基金连续第四周减持中国股票 深证成指乐观情绪消退
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）的一份报告显示，随着低成本人工智能初创公司深鉴科技（DeepSeek）点燃的对中国科技股的热情开始消退，全球对冲基金连续四周继续抛售中国股票。【原文：Global hedge funds continued to sell China equities for a fourth straight week as the renewed enthusiasm for Chinese tech stocks, ignited by low-cost artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek, began to fade, a Goldman Sachs note showed.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，数以千计的用户的社交媒体平台 X 出现故障
item.description: 据停电跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 称，美国和英国有数千名用户的社交媒体平台 X 出现故障。【原文：Social media platform X is down for thousands of users in the U.S. and the UK, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结美国农业部开支，农民搁置计划和投资
item.description: 蒙大拿州贝尔格莱德外的有机农场主 Nate Powell-Palm 依靠美国农业部农业营销服务部提供的 64.8 万美元赠款，帮助建立了一家饲料厂，这是该地区约 150 名有机谷物农场主的经济命脉。【原文：Nate Powell-Palm, an organic farmer outside Belgrade, Montana, was relying on a $648,000 grant from USDA's Agricultural Marketing Service to help build a feed mill - an economic lifeline for about 150 area organic grain farmers.】

item.title: 欧洲在扣押俄罗斯资产问题上面临严峻抉择
item.description: 在瞬息万变的全球经济中，欧元作为储备货币的地位面临着日益严峻的挑战，目前，欧洲各国政府在权衡可能扣押俄罗斯被冻结资产所带来的影响时，暂时没有采取任何行动。【原文：Growing challenges to the euro's status as a reserve currency in a fast-changing global economy are, for now, staying the hand of European capitals as they weigh up the repercussions of a potential seizure of frozen Russian assets.】

item.title: 洞察力：特斯拉的股价多年来一直无视地心引力。埃隆-马斯克的电动汽车派对结束了吗？
item.description: 特斯拉的股价在三个月内下跌了近一半。即便如此，投资者仍在争论埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的电动汽车制造商是否仍然定价过高。【原文：Tesla’s stock has dropped by nearly half in three months. Even so, investors are still debating whether Elon Musk's electric-vehicle maker remains overpriced.】

item.title: 利物浦与阿迪达斯签订多年合约，取代耐克
item.description: 据英国媒体报道，利物浦已与阿迪达斯签订了一份多年期的球衣协议，从下赛季开始，阿迪达斯将取代运动服制造商耐克，协议为期五年，每年价值超过 6000 万英镑（约合 7736 万美元）。【原文：Liverpool have signed a multi-year kit deal with Adidas beginning next season that will replace sportswear manufacturer Nike, in what British media reports say is a five-year agreement worth more than 60 million pounds ($77.36 million) per year.】

item.title: 利物浦与阿迪达斯签订多年合约，取代耐克
item.description: 据英国媒体报道，利物浦已与阿迪达斯签订了一份多年期的球衣协议，从下赛季开始，阿迪达斯将取代运动服制造商耐克，协议为期五年，每年价值超过 6000 万英镑（约合 7736 万美元）。【原文：Liverpool have signed a multi-year kit deal with Adidas beginning next season that will replace sportswear manufacturer Nike, in what British media reports say is a five-year agreement worth more than 60 million pounds ($77.36 million) per year.】

item.title: 日本牧野铣削公司称收到的收购报价与日本电产不相上下
item.description: 日本牧野铣床公司（Makino Milling Machine）周一表示，该公司已收到具有法律约束力的第三方收购建议书，可与日本电产主动提出的收购要约相媲美。【原文：Japan's Makino Milling Machine said on Monday it has received legally binding third-party proposals for acquisition that rival an unsolicited buyout offer from Nidec .】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，福特将向德国业务注资 47.6 亿美元
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，福特汽车公司将向其陷入困境的德国分公司注资多达 44 亿欧元（47.6 亿美元），以重振其在欧洲的汽车业务。【原文：Ford Motor will inject up to EUR 4.4 billion ($4.76 billion) into its struggling German unit as it tries to revive its car business in Europe, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 因美国调查风险，惠誉给予印度阿达尼能源公司负面展望
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）将印度能源基础设施公司阿达尼能源解决方案有限公司（Adani Energy Solutions Limited）的评级展望定为负面，理由是对公司治理和美国正在进行的调查所带来的潜在风险表示担忧。【原文：Fitch Ratings has assigned a negative outlook to Indian energy infrastructure company Adani Energy Solutions Limited , citing concerns over corporate governance and potential risks from ongoing U.S. investigations.】

item.title: 2025 年前两个月中国汽车销量增长 1.3
item.description: 2025 年前两个月，中国汽车销量同比增长 1.3%，原因是扩大用户补贴计划刺激了汽车需求，同时一场新的智能电动汽车价格战正在展开。【原文：China's car sales inched up 1.3% in the first two months of 2025 from the same period a year earlier, as an expanded customer subsidy programme spurred auto demand while a new smart electric vehicle price war unfolds.】
